com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.checking.inline.markings.offset

Interface OffsetCalculator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OffsetCalculatorImpl

    public interface OffsetCalculator
    The OffsetCalculator is used to calculate the AbsoluteRange containing the absolute offsets in the original document.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<AbsoluteRange> calculateOffsets(Marking marking)
      Calculates the AbsoluteRange containing the absolute offsets in the original document.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateOffsets

        Set<AbsoluteRange> calculateOffsets(Marking marking)
        Calculates the AbsoluteRange containing the absolute offsets in the original document. If you are using a simple document, you could use Document.getOriginalOffset(int). If you are using a BlockDocument you could use MarkingsFactory.createOffsetMarkings(OffsetCalculator, OffsetMarkingList, OffsetEditorView) to create a calculator. 
         public Set<AbsoluteRange> calculateOffsets(final Marking marking)
 {
     final Set<AbsoluteRange> absoluteRanges = Sets.newHashSet();
     for (final DocumentPart<Integer> documentPart : document.getOriginalDocumentParts(marking)) {
         final int offset = documentPart.getPositionInDocument();
 
         final AbsoluteRange absoluteRange = new AbsoluteRangeImpl(
                 offset + documentPart.getRelativeRange().getBegin(),
                 offset + documentPart.getRelativeRange().getEnd());
 
         absoluteRanges.add(absoluteRange);
     }
     return absoluteRanges;
 }
        Parameters:
        marking - The Range used by DocumentPartMapping.getOriginalDocumentParts(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.extraction.documents.block.Range) to get the DocumentPart to calculate the AbsoluteRange.
        Returns:
        A set of AbsoluteRanges. This could be created by mapping from Marking to original DocumentParts. Then the AbsoluteRange := DocumentPart.getRelativeRange() + DocumentPart.getPositionInDocument()
